gurmukhi: BeI auphwsI dyh pUqn ibnwsI AibnwsI qyrI hwsI hmY gwsI sI lgq hY ]52]
translation: Because of the death of our son, we are also being ridiculed, O Immortal Lord ! such a cruel joke by you is sharply stinging us like an arrow.”52.

gurmukhi: pwcvo puqR BXo suin kMs su pwQr sO hin mwir dXo hY ] sÍws gXo niB ky mg mY qn qwko ikDO jmnw mY gXo hY ]
transliteration: Paachavo Paachavo Poutra Bhayo Soun(i) Kans Su Paathar Sau Han(i) Daar(i) Dayo Hai|| Svaas Gado Nabh(i) Ke Mag Mai Tan Taako Kidhau Jamnaa Mai Gado Hai||
translation: Hearing about the birth of fifth son, Kansa also killed him by dashing him against the store; the soul of the infant went to heaven and his body was merged in the flowing current;

gurmukhi: so suin kY pun sRonn dyvkI Sok sON sws ausws lXo hY ] moh BXo Aiq qw idn mY mno XwhI qy moh pRkwS BXo hY ]53]
transliteration: So Soun(i) Kai Poun Sronan Devakishok Saoun Saas Ousaas Layo Hai|| Moh Bhayo At(i) Taa Din Mai Mano Yaahite Moh Prakaadh Bhayo Hai||53||
translation: Hearing this, Devaki began to sigh and because of the attachment she experienced such a great anguish that she appeared to have given birth to the attachment itself.53.
Speech regarding the supplication of Devaki:

gurmukhi: puqR BXo Cto bMs so BI mwir fwrXo kMs dovkI pukwrI nwQ bwq suin lIjIAY ] kIjIAY AnwQ n snwQ myry dInw nwQ hmY mwr dIjIAY ik Xwko mwr jIAY ]
transliteration: Poutra Bhayo Chhatho Bans So Bhidaar(i) Ddaryo Kans Devakipoukaarinaath Baat Soun(i) Lijiai|| Keejeeal Anaath Na Sanaath Dere Dinaa Naath Hamai Maar Deejeeal Ki Yaako Maar Dijeeai||
translation: When the sixth son was also killed by Kansa, Devaki prayed thus to God, “O Master of the lowly ! either kill us or kill Kansa;

gurmukhi: kMs bfo pwpI jwko lok BXo jwpI soeI kIjIAY hmwrI dsw jwqy suKI jIjIAY ] sRonn mY suin As vwrI gj vwrI kro lweIAY n FIl Ab do mY eyk kIjIAY ]54]
transliteration: Kans Bado Paapilik Bhayo Jaapisoikijeeai Hamaaridasa Jate Soukhijijiai|| Sronan Mai Soun(i) As Vaarigad Vaaridaro Laaeeai Na Dheel Ab Do Mai Ek Keejeeai||54||
translation: “Kansa is a great sinner, whom the people consider as their king and whom they remember; O Lord! Put him in the same condition as Thou hast put us; I have heard that Thou didst save the life of the elephant; do not delay now, be kind to do any one of the
End of the description regarding the killing of the sixth son.
Now begins the description about the Birth of Balbhadra

gurmukhi: jO blBdR BXo grBwNqr qO duhUM bYT kY mMqR kirE hY ] qwhI qy mMqR ky jor so kwF kY rohnI ky aur bIc DirE hY ]
transliteration: Jau Balbhadra Bhayo Gaddhaalntar Tau Duhoon Baith Kai Mantra Kario Hai|| Taaite Mantra Ke Jor So Kaadh Kai Rohanike Ur Beech Dhario Hai||
translation: When balbhadra was conceived, Devaki and Vasudev sat to hold consultations and with the power of mantras, he was transferred from the womb of Devaki to the womb of Rohini;

gurmukhi: kMs kdwNc hnY iss ko iqh qy mn mY bsdyv firE hY ] syK mno jg dyKn ko jg BIqr rUp nbIn kirE hY ]55]
transliteration: Kans Kadaanch Hanai Sis Ko Tih Te Man Mai Basdev Dario Hai|| Sekh Mano Jag Dekhan Ko Jag Bheetar Roop Naveen Kario Hai||55||
translation: Thinking that Kansa may also kill him, Vasudev was frightened. It seemed that Sheshanaga had assumed a new form in order to see the world.55.
